sections: Few Corvettes were sprayed in this beautiful bright factory color.
When it comes to "America's Sports Car", the Corvette has come a long way. For the first time in the car's 67-year history, the eighth-generation model is now powered by a mid-mounted V8 engine.
is excited to offer the opportunity to own this highly desired and rare-colored
. This car is scheduled on the docket for Saturday, July 24th so make sure to register and place that winning bid on this head-turning sports car.

Finished in the stunningly bold hue of Sebring Orange Tintcoat, only 3,065 Corvettes don this brilliant factory color including 2,980 examples in 2019 and a mere 85 in 2018. The car also features a removable body-color roof panel so you can soak up the sunshine while cruising those scenic backroads. A set of Bright-Silver-painted 5-spoke aluminum wheels (19x8.5 front, 20x11 rear) sit on all four corners and are wrapped with Michelin rubber (245/35ZR/19 front, 305/30ZR/20 rear). Also, carbon flash side vents along with front and rear grille accents adorn the exterior, and it wears a Z51 rear spoiler. Power-heated mirrors come with integrated turn signal indicators. A car cover comes with the car to protect the beautiful bright paint against the elements wherever you park it.

Equipped with the Z51 Performance Package, this is the fastest accelerating Corvette ever produced. Powering this new C8 Corvette is the aforementioned mid-mounted 6.2-liter V8 capable of 490-horsepower and 465 lb/ft of torque, and it is backed by an 8-speed dual-clutch transmission with manual and auto modes. Mechanical highlights include a performance rear-axle ratio, locking limited-slip differential, Z51 performance brakes, a unique performance suspension, and exhaust.

Open the doors to a stunning interior full of all sorts of modern technology such as 4G LTE Wi-Fi hotspot capability, Apple CarPlay, wireless charging, as well as Android Auto capable. This new Corvette features a remote vehicle starter system. That's not all since this car is features the 2LT Equipment Group. That means the car has a navigation system, a Bose 14-speaker audio system, a head-up display, a rear camera in the mirror, an HD front curb view camera, performance data and video recorder, rear cross-traffic alert, side blind zone alert, and smart device integration. Comforts come with heated and vented GT bucket seats and a heated steering wheel.
would make your life complete, make sure to check out
on Saturday, July 24th. Make sure to register so you can place that winning bid to take home this stunning and powerful C8.
